data.title: Early Sunday breakfast
data.text: Not our greatest here for breakfast. Food took longer than average because they mixed up/forget part of my crepe order (Lemon. Raspberry and Nutella). Hubby ordered the brat wrap, which he's had before and enjoyed. This time the bread was so hard he couldn't cut it with a knife and had to break it off is brat. Crepes when they came out were really good.

data.title: Yummy burgers
data.text: Husband and I had their burger special and it was awesome, with mushrooms and bacon. The food is always good here.

data.title: Preferred Lunch Menu to Breakfast but both good
data.text:
First off, I've been here for breakfast a few times with friends. It's never been my top choice but not somewhere I dislike going. The breakfast to me just seems to be lacking something. However, let me tell you that I just went for a business lunch and boy was I blown away. I got the Ultimate Grilled Cheese sandwich with the soup of the day which was broccoli cheddar. I don't like broccoli, like at all. So when the soup came I was not looking forward to trying it. I sampled a colleague's strawberry spinach salad first and it was mind blowing. It is a combination of fresh strawberries, spinach leaves, big blue cheese crumbles and thinly sliced almonds. The dressing is a raspberry vinaigrette and somehow all of those flavors just explode in your mouth. If you like salads, I would highly recommend it. 

My sandwhich was good but the stand outs were definitely the broccoli cheddar soup and that strawberry spinach salad. Both, gold medal worthy. 

The place gets a tad busy and it's not unusual during peak times to have a line backed up against the door. The service isn't notably fast or slow and the dining room can get quite loud when packed but this cafe is a nice change from the regular downtown Billings go-tos for me.

data.title: Very good breakfast for not having many choices
data.text: Decided to try something different for breakfast.  It had been a few years since we ate here for breakfast. It's a good alternative to Bernies or Stellas and a short walk from the downtown hotels.

data.title: This place is different but okay to eat at.
data.text: Your menu is on chalk boards on the wall. You order then go sit down for the staff to bring you your meal. The food was not bad. They have fairly big cinnamon rolls. Place was clean and very unique. Wait staff was polite. I cannot remember but on one of their open days they only serve breakfast.

data.title: Relaxing and wonderful food!!
data.text: Whether it is breakfast, lunch or just dessert, they have the best coffee!!!! Relaxing, can take your computer if necessary, or just visit with friends!!! Wonderful!

data.title: Great local spot for casual dining
data.text:
We stopped in for a late breakfast/lunch while we were on business in Billings. We were able to walk their from our hotel which was very convenient. The servers were friendly and the food was fresh! We shared one of their awesome cinnamon rolls as well which was a treat. 
This is a safe bet if you're looking for a good meal at a good price in a clean and  friendly environment!

data.title: On the downhill.
data.text: I understand this place has changed hands, and it's not a good thing.  My over-easy eggs were hard, the bacon undercooked, and it looked at though the cook spilled black pepper in the hash browns.  This used to be a special spot to eat.  They still give you an order #, then blunder around wondering who to give the order to.  Kind of strange, really.  If I go back to a meeting here, I'll have eaten already.

data.title: Muffaletta is excellent!!
data.text: Tried this for lunch today and it's SO good!!  Brings back memories of the Italian subs that used to be popular.  Large sandwich--easily feeds 2 (or leftover for dinner).  Genoa salami, ham and turkey, lettuce & tomato, Provolone, basil mayo and olive spread on focaccia bread.  Very tasty!!  Staff is great too!!

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: I had high hopes going here and expected to be charmed. I was disappointed by the mediocre food and dismissive staff. I felt I would have been served a similar meal at Perkins but probably would have gotten better service. The best part about this place is the exposed brick and location downtown.

data.title: Worst breakfast EVER
data.text: I went to breakfast Saturday morning April 30. I ordered steak and eggs. I asked it to be cooked medium rare. Another person at the table ordered the same. I wish I had taken a picture of the  breakfast when it arrived. The steak may have started out at 6 oz, but by the time it was served it was black, charred and over cooked and it was probably cooked down to 4oz. The smallest and worst cooked piece of meat I can ever remember getting at a restaurant! They were out of hash browns so they served chunked fried potatoes. They were ok but it was possibly a quarter of a potato served. Very small portion.. The eggs and toast were ok, but for the price with coffee($14.40), it was absolutely the worst overpriced meal I have ever had. Another person at the table ordered French toast and a side of sausage. The sausage was never delivered! I Will not ever go there again.

data.title: Great Coffee!
data.text:
I ordered a typical breakfast meal to be safe. I ordered eggs, bacon, and banana pancakes. My eggs were great, bacon was burnt, but the pancakes were amazing! Their coffee blend is a must try!! 
I still think Stella's gives you more food for the price!!

data.title: Nice place to have lunch.
data.text: Good food in a nice atmosphere.  Fresh quality food and a nice selection of choices.  Save room for dessert.

data.title: Quaint; great food!!
data.text: My first and definitely not last visit!!  Fresh made breakfasts and lunches; very cozy while spacious. Clean; very kind staff.

data.title: Nice but no table service
data.text:
Our bad for not realizing McCormick's is an order-in-line, serve-your-own coffee place. 

The line was long this Sunday morning and snaked around the tables so once we were eating we had lots of close standing company.

The menu is good, interesting, varied. No hash browns, just chunky potatoes with parmesan cheese on top.

data.title: Super Sandwiches!
data.text: Their menu selection for both breakfast and lunch is awesome. On this day I tried a grilled cheese made with 3 cheeses AND bacon.  OH MY GOSH!  It was delicious.  They also offer wonderful wraps, soups and salads, in addition to their full breakfast menu. I once had a breakfast omelet that was the best EVER!  Their website says it's the place where locals eat--it's true.

data.title: Great coffee and breakfast - Cozy Place
data.text: This is such a great place for breakfast and coffee. All my Billings friends like this place. The Biscuits and Gravy are pretty tasty.

data.title: Such nice people!
data.text: perfect spot for late breakfast or lunch. I love their omelets and it's a comfortable atmosphere to take the kids.

data.title: My first choice for breakfast in Billings!
data.text: Always a good meal in a delightful historical building.  I love the Oxford French toast.  Great coffee & good atmosphere.

data.title: Nice breakfast spot on a Sunday
data.text: McCormick Café is a spacious restaurant with plenty of seating for larger groups, a view of the street or a quiet spot in the back away from the doors. When you walk in grab a table then walk up to the counter and place your order. We recommend parking on the street or the large lot across the street from the Café as the restaurants lot is very small. McCormick’s also offers private rooms for parties and business meetings. The service is good and the breakfast food is great!
